intro: Saviniona brachyloba, commonly known as the short-lobed savin, is a shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypress and juniper species. The plant is characterized by its scale-like leaves and small, seed-bearing cones. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of chaparral and woodland ecosystems.
